page.title: 15Norton Interview:continued.
page.content: Mr.Norton delivers his bread and cakes to Barnham Broom,Barford, Garvestone,Reymerston and Toftwood as well as Mattishall.He employs two other people.He has worked in the bakery since he left school.On Fridays Mr.Norton shuts the shop at 18.00 and starts work again at 19.30 until 01.30 on Saturday. When Mr.Norton lived in the village as a boy there were far fewer houses and bungalows,far more open fields. There was no doctor's surgery: when you were ill you went to the doctor's house. He notices much more traffic now,particularly heavy traffic.He wishes someone would slow the lorries down! When he went to school there were only seventy-five school children in the whole of Mattishall!
